alert.note: Alert for Caroline; Eastern Essex; Richmond; Western Essex; Westmoreland (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 16 at 6:20PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Richmond, east central Caroline, southwestern Westmoreland and Essex Counties through 700 PM EDT... At 620 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Loretto, or 9 miles northwest of Champlain, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, half inch hail, and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Reduced visibilty and minor flooding possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Loretto around 635 PM EDT. Leedstown around 640 PM EDT. Champlain around 655 PM EDT. Tappahannock and Newland around 700 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Hustle, Elevon, Supply, Singerly, Central Point, Rexburg, Chance, Naylors Beach, Mount Landing and Brays Fork. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for north central and east central Virginia.

area.areaDesc: Caroline; Eastern Essex; Richmond; Western Essex; Westmoreland
